message.entry: View power density spectrum of signals

Sample rate of input signals in Hz
Select harmonic or intermodulation distortion measurements
Specify the number of harmonics to measure
Phase noise measurement (Requires a Mixed-Signal Blockset license)
Frequency points relative to fundamental frequency where phase noise is calculated
Target phase noise profile for given frequency offset vector
Specify the type of input signal
Frequency vector for x-axis labels. Enter value in Hz or select Auto
Choose how you want to control frequency resolution
Resolution bandwidth in Hz. Enter value in Hz or select Auto
Fixed samples per update regardless of the window choice
Number of FFT points. Enter value or select Auto

entry.note: As in the amount to forget
As in the amount to forget

message.entry: Forgetting factor of 0 means no averaging and a value of 1 means maximum averaging
Video bandwidth in Hz. Enter value in Hz or select Auto
Enable trace with running maximum spectral values
Enable trace with running minimum spectral values
Frequency scale.\nLog-scale is only valid for one-sided spectrum displays
Reference load, in Ohms, used to scale spectrum
Display power in units of dBm, dBW, Watts, and dBFS
Display power in units of dBm, dBW, Watts, and dBFS
Display power density in units of dBm/Hz, dBW/Hz, Watts/Hz, and dBFS/Hz
Display power in units of dBm
Display power density in units of dBm/Hz
Display RMS in units of dBV, dBuV and Vrms
Display spectrum in units of dBm, dBV, dBuV, dBW, Vrms, and Watts
Full scale. Enter maximum possible level or select Auto
Channel for which spectrogram is displayed
Time resolution for each spectrogram line in seconds
Time resolution for each spectrogram line in seconds. The minimum attainable resolution for current settings is: {0} s
Time span over which the analyzer displays the spectrogram
Time span over which the analyzer displays the spectrogram. Must be larger than or equal to {0} s
Select occupied bandwidth or adjacent channel power ratio measurements
Specify the number of adjacent channel pairs
Specify the span of the adjacent channel
Specify the frequency of the adjacent channel relative to the center frequency of the main channel
Select the channel filter to apply to both main and adjacent channels
Specify the 3-dB bandwidth-symbol time product with respect to the main channel bandwidth (span)
Specify the roll-off factor with respect to the main channel bandwidth (span)
Specify channel for spectrum peak reference level
Specify mask frequency offset in Hz
Minimum and maximum limit of y-axis
Minimum and maximum limits of color bar
Number of spectrum updates processed by the scope
Number of input samples required to compute an update
Normalized effective noise bandwidth of window
Channel for which spectrogram is displayed
Enter sample rate of input signals as a finite positive real scalar.
Enter sample rate as a finite positive real scalar greater than or equal to {0} Hz.
Enter sample rate as a finite positive real scalar greater than {0} Hz.
Enter RBW as 'Auto' or as a finite positive real scalar.
RBW value as 'Input port' is not supported while the simulation is running.
Enter RBW such that span/RBW is greater than or equal to 2.
Enter filter sharpness as a finite nonnegative real scalar between 0 and 1.
Enter window length as a finite positive real scalar greater than 2.
Enter FFT length as a finite positive real scalar greater than or equal to {0}.
Enter window length as a finite positive real scalar less than or equal to FFT length {0}.
Enter VBW as 'Auto' or as a finite nonnegative real scalar.
VBW value as 'Input port' is not supported while the simulation is running.
Enter VBW such that span/VBW is greater than or equal to 2.
Enter forgetting factor as a finite nonnegative real scalar between 0 and 1.
Enter spectral averages as a finite positive integer.
Enter frequency offset as a finite real scalar.
Enter reference load as a finite positive real scalar.
Enter full scale as a finite positive real scalar.
Enter start frequency as a finite real scalar.
Enter stop frequency as a finite real scalar.
Enter span as a finite positive real scalar.
Enter center frequency as a finite real scalar.
Enter time resolution 'Auto' or as a finite positive real scalar.
Enter time resolution as a finite positive real scalar larger than or equal to {0} seconds.
Enter time resolution as a finite positive real scalar larger than sample time {0} seconds.
Enter time span as 'Auto' or as a finite real positive scalar.
Enter time span as a finite real positive scalar larger than {0} seconds.
Enter overlap percentage as a finite nonnegative real scalar less than 100.
Enter sidelobe attenuation as a finite real scalar greater than or equal to 45.
Enter number of harmonics as a finite positive real scalar between 2 and 99.
Enter upper mask as a real, numeric scalar or two-column matrix with at least two rows.
Enter upper mask as a real, numeric scalar or two-column matrix with at least two rows.
Enter spectral mask frequency offset as a finite real scalar.
Enter reference level as 'Spectrum peak' or as a finite real scalar.
Enter percent occupied bandwidth as a finite real scalar between 0 and 100 exclusive.
Enter ACPR offsets as a finite positive real vector with length equal to the specified number of ACPR Offsets.
Enter number of ACPR offsets as a finite positive real scalar between 1 and 64.
Enter filter coefficient as a finite nonnegative real scalar between 0 and 1.
Enter phase noise frequency offsets as a real vector of length between 2 and 99.
Enter target phase noise profile as a real vector of length equal to the length of frequency offsets.
The RBW {0} {1} yields a {2} point FFT. The scope uses an RBW of {3} {4}.
The window length {0} yields a {1} point FFT. The scope uses a window length of {2}.
The Spectrum Analyzer requires {0} additional samples to achieve the default RBW {1} {2}. The current number of input samples provided achieves an RBW of {3} {4}.
The Spectrum Analyzer requires {0} additional samples to achieve the desired RBW {1} {2}. The current number of input samples provided achieves an RBW of {3} {4}.
Your changes will apply when you call the step method of the Spectrum Analyzer object.
CCDF measurements are not supported with Spectrum Analyzer object. Use powermeter object to compute and visualize CCDF measurements.
The auto full scale does not support inputs with word length greater than 1023.

Spectrum Analyzer data includes NaN or Inf values. The scope includes the NaN or Inf data values while computing the spectral averages. To exclude NaN or Inf values, select 'Ignore NaNs when calculating statistics' from MATLAB Settings > Workspace.

Spectrum Analyzer data includes NaN or Inf values. The scope excludes the NaN or Inf data values while computing the spectral averages. To include NaN or Inf values, select 'Use NaNs when calculating statistics' from MATLAB Settings > Workspace.
Your changes will apply when the simulation is started.
Spectrum cannot be displayed for continuous or infinite sample times.

This Spectrum Analyzer block was saved with settings that require a valid DSP System Toolbox license. Replace it with a Spectrum Analyzer block from Simscape > Utilities library or RF Blockset > Circuit Envelope > Utilities library.
Setting number of input ports to {0} switched the RBW source from Input port to Auto.
Setting number of input ports to {0} switched the VBW source from Input port to Auto.
Setting number of input ports to {0} switched the frequency vector source from Input port to Auto.
Setting number of input ports to {0} switched all the parameters with Input port source to Auto.
No signal is connected to this Spectrum Analyzer viewer. Connect a valid signal to see its spectrum.
No signal is connected to this Spectrum Analyzer scope. Connect a valid signal to see its spectrum.
Enter number of inputs as a positive integer less than or equal to 96.
Enter [ymin ymax], where ymin and ymax are finite scalars.
Enter [cmin cmax], where cmin and cmax are finite scalars.
Enter data display precision as a finite positive real scalar between 1 and 15.
When the PlotAsTwoSidedSpectrum property is true, the frequency scale must be linear.
When the InputDomain property value is "frequency", all inputs must be real.
Data with more than two dimensions is not supported.
The number of FFT points must be a finite, positive integer greater than or equal to the window length, {0}. Increase the number of FFT points or change the window length to {1}.

The number of FFT points must be a finite, positive integer greater than or equal to the number of samples needed to produce one spectrum update, {0}. Increase the number of FFT points or change the RBW to {1} {2}Hz so that samples per update changes to {3}.
The number of frequency bands must be a finite, positive integer greater than or equal to 2.
The frequency vector must be a finite, monotonically increasing vector with 2 or more elements.
The frequency vector must be a finite, monotonically increasing vector. The number of elements in the vector must equal the input frame size.
The interval [{0}, {1}] {2}Hz defined by the frequency span and center frequency exceeds the Nyquist frequency limits which equal [{3}, {4}] {5}Hz.

The interval [{0}, {1}] {2}Hz defined by the start and stop frequencies exceeds the Nyquist frequency limits which equal [{3}, {4}] {5}Hz. To change the start and stop frequencies, select Estimation tab on the toolstrip and change the span options under the Frequency Options section.
The frequency span over RBW ratio must be greater than or equal to 2.
When the RBWSource is set to 'property', SampleRate must be greater than or equal to 2 * RBW: {0} {1}Hz.
The specified time resolution is causing the frequency span over RBW ratio to be smaller than 2. Your time resolution must be greater than or equal to {0}.
The time resolution must be larger than or equal to the minimum attainable resolution which for the current settings equals {0}.
The frequency span over VBW ratio must be greater than or equal to 2.
When the VBWSource is set to 'property', SampleRate must be greater than {0} {1}Hz.
Spectrogram channel number must be less than or equal to the total number of input channels to the scope, {0}.
YLimits must be a 2-element finite numeric vector with the second element greater than the first element.
ColorLimits must be a 2-element finite numeric vector with the second element greater than the first element.
Spectrum cannot be calculated as one-sided for complex data.
''{0}'' must have exactly one input argument and one output argument.
''{0}'' is shadowing a MATLAB function. Use a different function name.
Custom function ''{0}'' output must be a column vector with the same size specified by the function input.
The length of the input must be greater than or equal to 2.
When the number of inputs is greater than one, all inputs must have the same frame size.
At least one of the PlotNormalTrace, PlotMaxHoldTrace, and PlotMinHoldTrace properties must be set to true.
The start frequency must be smaller than the stop frequency.
Changing the value of the non-tunable property {0} is not allowed without first calling the release() method.
In this configuration of the object, the {0} property is not applicable.
The ReducePlotRate property is obsolete and will be removed in a future release.
The PowerUnits property is obsolete and will be removed in a future release. Use SpectrumUnits instead.
The SpectrumType property value "spectrogram" is obsolete and will be removed in a future release. Use ViewType property and set its value to "spectrogram" instead.
The CCDFMeasurements property is removed. Use powermeter object instead to compute and visualize CCDF measurements.
The {0} property must be set to a valid SpectralMaskSpecification object.
{0} is not a valid setting for the {1} property.
The {0} property value must be a real, numeric scalar or two-column matrix with at least two rows.
When the {0} property value is a matrix, the first column representing frequency values of the mask must be non-NaN and non-decreasing.
Mask selected channel must be less than or equal to the total number of input channels to the scope, {0}.
The {0} mask defined in the SpectralMask property falls outside the frequency axis limits of the Spectrum Analyzer.
{0} requires a valid license for DSP System Toolbox.
In order to use {0}, you must have a valid Mixed-Signal Blockset license.
